com.projetloki.genesis

Class MediaFeature

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projetloki.genesis.MediaFeature

  • @PoorBrowserSupport
public final class MediaFeature
extends Object
    An expression that check for the conditions of particular media features.
    Author:
    Cl√©ment Roux
    See Also:
    MediaQuery.and(MediaFeature), MDN, Browser support

    • Method Detail

      • width

        public static MediaFeature width(double length,
                 LengthUnit unit)
        Returns a feature that checks that the width of the targeted display area is exactly the given length. For continuous media, refers to the width of the viewport including the size of a rendered scroll bar (if any). For paged media, refers to the width of the page box.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given length is negative
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#width

      • minWidth

        public static MediaFeature minWidth(double length,
                    LengthUnit unit)
        Returns a feature that checks that the width of the targeted display area is at least the given length. For continuous media, refers to the width of the viewport including the size of a rendered scroll bar (if any). For paged media, refers to the width of the page box.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given length is negative
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#width

      • maxWidth

        public static MediaFeature maxWidth(double length,
                    LengthUnit unit)
        Returns a feature that checks that the width of the targeted display area is at most the given length. For continuous media, refers to the width of the viewport including the size of a rendered scroll bar (if any). For paged media, refers to the width of the page box.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given length is negative

      • deviceWidth

        public static MediaFeature deviceWidth(double length,
                       LengthUnit unit)
        Returns a feature that checks that the width of the output device's rendering surface is exactly the given length. For continuous media, refers to the width of the screen. For paged media, refers to the width of the page sheet size.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given length is negative
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#device-width

      • minDeviceWidth

        public static MediaFeature minDeviceWidth(double length,
                          LengthUnit unit)
        Returns a feature that checks that the width of the output device's rendering surface is at least the given length. For continuous media, refers to the width of the screen. For paged media, refers to the width of the page sheet size.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given length is negative
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#device-width

        public static MediaFeature portraitOrientation()
        Returns a feature that checks that the value of the height media feature is greater than or equal to the value of the width media feature.
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#orientation

      • aspectRatio

        public static MediaFeature aspectRatio(int w,
                       int h)
        Returns a feature that checks that the ratio of width to height is exactly the given ratio.
        Parameters:
        w - the width/numerator
        h - the height/denominator
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#aspect-ratio

      • color

        public static MediaFeature color()
        Returns a feature that checks that the device is a color device.
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#color

      • color

        public static MediaFeature color(int bitsPerColor)
        Returns a feature that checks that the number of bits per color is exactly the given number. If the device is not a color device, the value is zero.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given number is negative
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#color

      • minColor

        public static MediaFeature minColor(int bitsPerColor)
        Returns a feature that checks that the number of bits per color is at least the given number. If the device is not a color device, the value is zero.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given number is negative
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#color

      • maxColor

        public static MediaFeature maxColor(int bitsPerColor)
        Returns a feature that checks that the number of bits per color is at most the given number. If the device is not a color device, the value is zero.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given number is negative
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#color

      • colorIndex

        public static MediaFeature colorIndex(int n)
        Returns a feature that checks that the number of entries in the color lookup table is exactly the given number. If the device does not use a color lookup table, the value is zero.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given number is negative
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#color-index

      • minColorIndex

        public static MediaFeature minColorIndex(int n)
        Returns a feature that checks that the number of entries in the color lookup table is at least the given number. If the device does not use a color lookup table, the value is zero.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given number is negative
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#color-index

      • maxColorIndex

        public static MediaFeature maxColorIndex(int n)
        Returns a feature that checks that the number of entries in the color lookup table is at most the given number. If the device does not use a color lookup table, the value is zero.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given number is negative
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#color-index

      • monochrome

        public static MediaFeature monochrome()

      • monochrome

        public static MediaFeature monochrome(int bitsPerPixel)
        Returns a feature that checks that the number of bits per pixel in a monochrome frame buffer is exactly the given number. If the device is not a monochrome device, the value is 0.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given number is negative
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#monochrome

      • minMonochrome

        public static MediaFeature minMonochrome(int bitsPerPixel)
        Returns a feature that checks that the number of bits per pixel in a monochrome frame buffer is at least the given number. If the device is not a monochrome device, the value is 0.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given number is negative
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#monochrome

      • maxMonochrome

        public static MediaFeature maxMonochrome(int bitsPerPixel)
        Returns a feature that checks that the number of bits per pixel in a monochrome frame buffer is at most the given number. If the device is not a monochrome device, the value is 0.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given number is negative
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#monochrome

      • resolutionDpi

        public static MediaFeature resolutionDpi(int dpi)
        Returns a feature that checks that the resolution of the output device is exactly the given number of dots per inch. Never matches devices with non-square pixels. For printers, refers to the screening resolution (the resolution for printing dots of arbitrary color).
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#resolution

      • minResolutionDpi

        public static MediaFeature minResolutionDpi(int dpi)
        Returns a feature that checks that the resolution of the output device is at least the given number of dots per inch. For printers, refers to the screening resolution (the resolution for printing dots of arbitrary color).
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#resolution

      • maxResolutionDpi

        public static MediaFeature maxResolutionDpi(int dpi)
        Returns a feature that checks that the resolution of the output device is at most the given number of dots per inch. For printers, refers to the screening resolution (the resolution for printing dots of arbitrary color).
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#resolution

      • progressiveScan

        public static MediaFeature progressiveScan()
        Returns a feature that checks that the scanning process of the TV is progressive. Only applies to TV media types.
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#scan

      • interlaceScan

        public static MediaFeature interlaceScan()
        Returns a feature that checks that the scanning process of the TV is interlace. Only applies to TV media types.
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#scan

      • grid

        public static MediaFeature grid()
        Returns a feature that checks that the output device is grid (versus bitmap).
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#grid

      • grid

        public static MediaFeature grid(boolean grid)
        Returns a feature that checks that the output device is grid if true, or bitmap if false.
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/#grid
